titleStmt.title: Frank More et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9253

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
John B. Dixon
F. M. Wright
To His Excellency Gov B. Magoffin

The undersigned citizens of Fulton and Hickman counties -- would respectfully represent that about seven years ago George Morrow was convicted in the Fulton circuit court -- of Manslaughter (he having killed his own son) Morrow had been drunk for many years and we have no doubt -- but he was at the time deranged from the effects of whiskey, he has now been in the state prison for about seven years we think sufficiently long to work a reformation in him if possible to be done_ he is now about 65 years old_ and we believe and hope never will indulge in the use of whiskey again. We therefore respectfully pray your Excellency to grant him a pardon for the remainder of his time and restore him to a large & helpless family --

frank More
vince More
ed w Bruce
peter capoot
adam
John hooker
Burton Goin
T G Johnson
W. T. Dillon
Bilehart Baley
W C Jarvis
W C Wyatt
